Reviews.Author: Sarah
Reviews.Content: This place was awkward at first. When we walked in no one was there to sit us, I waited for a minute and then decided just to take a seat. However, once I went to sit down someone came out to help us. Not horrible, just awkward! The music also sounded a little like a Bollywood/slasher flick combined. There were moments it was terrifying and moments where it was fun and upbeat. There were several times I remarked to my date  do you hear this music?    Once we sat everything was pretty impressive. Our drinks were refilled on the regular. The first things that came out were the tabouli, pita bread, and eggplant fries with a side of Mediterranean butter. The fries came in a giant bowl. It was a lot more than we expected. They were good, but I preferred the zucchini fries that came later. The tabouli was citrusy/minty and delicious. The pita bread was puffy, like two slices of pita were stuck together and filled the middle with air. It wasn't bad, just not what I am used to. I actually may have liked it more because it felt  lighter.    The next appetizer that came out was Hollaum Cheese ant was fantastic. It comes out with three pieces of fried Lebanese cheese and cut up tomatoes, cucumbers, and pickles. It's $12, so I do have to say it is expensive for what you get. I wish it had at least four pieces of cheese. However, it was certainly my favorite dish of the night, and if you love cheese it is a must try!   Then our entrees came out, with my dates coming about 10 minutes after mine which was weird but forgivable. I had an entree size of the Greek salad, and it was HUGE. It was also incredibly unique. It had all the regular trappings of a Greek salad but also a little ZING. I don't know what gave it the kick at the end, but I ended up trading it for my partners beef shwarma. He LOVED the salad. The shwarma was eh. We subbed rice for zucchini fries - it was a good choice. Try something else tough.  I'm coming back to try those carrot fries!

Reviews.Author: Lindsay
Reviews.Content: I love this place. It is m y go-to lunch spot when I need a break from work. I have also gotten food to go to eat at my desk. The food is delicious and I usually get two meals out of it given the amount of food they give you.  My go-to order is the shawarma plate. The chicken shawarma is delicious and I love the tahini sauce with it. Along with the rice and veggies, you get quite the meal out of it. Also, it comes with a side which I always get the fatoosh salad. Best salad on the planet!   Even better is their pita bread. It is warm and delicious, but they can't make it fast enough. This is part of the reason I am giving them four stars as opposed to 5. Another reason is because of the service. They are very friendly, but they are FAR too busy to have only one waitress working during the lunch shift. I was bragging about this place to my co-workers and brought them in one day and the service was so slow and we were having to wave down the waitress for more drinks and pita bread. It was kind of embarrassing for me.   I hope they hire extra staff and I will change my review to 5 stars!

Reviews.Author: ClarenceWorley
Reviews.Content: Tried this spot the opening week, boy was I glad I did! Factory hummus made from scratch was delicious and on point! Tried the kabobs; holy smokes they were awesome. The filet kabob was tender and perfectly cooked, the chicken kabob was seasoned to perfection, and the shrimp kabob was so fresh! Service was prompt and attentive and I was surprised when I got the bill.  More than fair prices for excellent food! Try this spot!

Reviews.Author: Anthony
Reviews.Content: This place is absolutely phenomenal. I grew up with half my family being Lebanese and this is as good as I can get without going home. The servers are so genuine and quick to help in any way they can. Can't wait to come back.

Reviews.Author: Chuck
Reviews.Content: Good food especially hummus & pita Both are homemade Husband is from Lebanon & wife is from Vietnam Nam. Waitress is Thai. Sort of a little United Nations. Very clean nice little place Need to do something to let people know they are here No beer or wine license  yet so you can bring your own which is nice for a $5 corkage fee. Owners and staff are very friendly and attentive We will return

Reviews.Author: Christina
Reviews.Content: I'm ruined! The Greek salad was so incredibly tasty that we aren't sure any other place will even compete! Tory, our waitress, took great care of us and treated us like family. The pita bread! Omg! Most delicious thing ever!!!!!

Reviews.Author: Jette
Reviews.Content: It was suggested I try The Hummus Factory because they had great ratings and their food was good. I'm happy to say I wasn't let down, it does have good flavor and the portion sizes are large. It was easy to find they have a frontage location with plenty of parking. The moment I pulled up I said what a nice little place, upon waking in I was greeted with a smile and a hello welcome to hummus factory as she was serving a table. I think it's important to be acknowledged, especially when it's your first time in an establishment. The place is clean, friendly and fast service.  We had the chicken kabobs served on rice, Greek salad, hummus and a gyro! All of it was really good food.

Reviews.Author: Melodie
Reviews.Content: Some of the best falafel I have ever had. Service was amazing. Lunch portions were huge. A new go to place for sure. Can not wait to try all the different options!

Reviews.Author: Jennifer
Reviews.Content: Amazing food! Great ambience as well! Lunch or dinner, great place to go! Definitely recommending this place to everyone!

Reviews.Author: Jason
Reviews.Content: Top notch!   Absolutely outstanding!  I will have to update this when I have time to sit down at a real keyboard, but we can't remember being this blown away by a meal, possibly ever. Everything was wonderful, but for now, I want to touch on one item:  The Baba Ganoush    I'm no expert on Mediterranean cuisine. As such, baba ganoush has always been a  sure, I'll have some  kind of thing for me. I could take it or leave it.   Not this, though. This had so much more flavor than any I've ever had. If previous incarnations were a 4, The Hummus Factory's version is a 14! This is something special and I cannot say enough good things about it.

Reviews.Author: Corrina
Reviews.Content: I have to say this place is fantastic; from the service to the food, to the cleanliness of the wonderfully decorated space.  We ordered the shawarma plates(chicken &I beef) and zucchini fries, two kids pizzas and we Checked in and received a free hummus which was fantastic.  If you haven't visited this establishment you are missing out. It's a must!!  This was our first time and we will definitely be back!!

Reviews.Author: Paul
Reviews.Content: There's so many things done right in this family run business - great service, fresh food, clean restaurant and restrooms - great tasting food. Fresh iced tea with the perfect crushed ice and stevia! I've been here several times and this review is late...  The hummus protein dinner, fresh pita, lentil soup - my favorites. Don't forget the labne appetizer!  I've tried the baklava and shabiet desserts - both were delicious.  Thank You for great meals and great service

Reviews.Author: Amal
Reviews.Content: Best Middle Eastern Restaurant in town. This is the place to go and eat, the food is excellent the portion is good, The hot bread is out of this world. The most important thing is the food is always the same, Not like other restaurant some times it is good and other times no so good.   Try the fattoush salad with chicken shawarma. Don't forget the garlic!  and for some of you who likes spicy food, try the sujuk,it's my favorite. we will be back.

Reviews.Author: Steve
Reviews.Content: Very good--almost five star good. I had the falafel sandwich; it was very fresh-tasting--I assume they make their falafel in house. The seasoning on it was tasty. I got an upgrade of fried, lightly breaded zucchini  fries , which were tasty but far too plentiful for me to finish. The service is very friendly.

Reviews.Author: Moya
Reviews.Content: I went to the Hummus Factory for dinner. The food was great and the server was outstanding. I ate the beef kabob. It's a must try. I'm Very pleased with the restaurant and will return for more thank you very much  THE HUMMUS FACTORY  keep it up.

Reviews.Author: Sarah
Reviews.Content: Great place, great prices, family owned and operated, fantastic food! What more can you ask?! Walked in for first time and LOVED the decor, elegant country style that's very inviting. Was going to just grab some to-go hummus but had to sit and relax at the food bar just to take in the ambience. You can easily feel all the time and care that went into building the new Hummus Factory. Watched all the food come out from the open kitchen and the portions are huge with gorgeous plating and everything smells amazing. I know where I'll be taking my family for lunch next time! Congratulations on a beautiful restaurant and stunning menu! Eggplant fries, here I come! If you're looking for an affordable, restful place to get delicious, high-quality Mediterranean food, this is it. You won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Author: Loretta
Reviews.Content: The service was nice ,a little slow for being on my lunch break. The food was decent  but I was so disappointed my chicken gyro did not have any cucumber on it overall it was ok.  Does not hold a candle to yasou greek on Charleston.

Reviews.Author: Chynna
Reviews.Content: The food here is just wonderful. I've been hooked from the first time dining at this restaurant since then I've brought friends and family to eat multiple times. I definitely  eat here at least once a week. Combo kabob plate their meat is so good anyone you choose and then the greek burger so great! Top it off the staff are super friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Author: Alex
Reviews.Content: the chicken shawarma and the steak fries... i died a little inside when i took my first bite, it was too bomb i thought i was going to be elevated to a higher existence. seriously. this place. also the staff is very friendly and they're always on top of it!

Reviews.Author: Becky
Reviews.Content: Yet another Mediterranean restaurant in a 2 block radius. Pitas good. Hand made. I liked the sampler

Reviews.Author: April
Reviews.Content: Amazing food and awesome service. Must try this place out!! So good!!!  Hours are great. Place is clean and customer service is awesome.

Reviews.Author: Lauren
Reviews.Content: Just came here for dinner with my mom and son. This is the best Mediterranean food I have had by far. Service was excellent, nice new restaurant and very clean, and nice decor. Hummus was very good with the fresh pita bread. We got eggplant fries for an appetizer and they're so good! I got the chicken kabob for dinner, super yummy. I will definitely be back soon! I recommend this to everyone!

Reviews.Author: Diana
Reviews.Content: Dude.   Insane flavors going on here. First off, if youre going to come here, clear your mind of traditional Mediterranean food. They have their own twist on things-you gotta if you want to really appreciate what they do.    Wait service was awesome. Pleasant. Helpful. Funny! Offered bread refills very often. Never an empty glass.   Food: Baba ganoush. Do it. Factory hummus. Get it. The pita. You already know. AND it's fresh baked. My friend had the pretzel bun sliders. To quote,  this is the best burger I've ever had.  He said in a wonder. I had the sausage with lemon sauce.  Delicious. Possibly my only complaint was that it was a tad dry in comparison to everything else but maaaaan. Them flavors. Mmm. Mmm. Definitely coming back.   P.s. bathrooms were clean as a whistle and they honored the yelp check in!

Reviews.Author: Amy
Reviews.Content: First off I just wanted to say that this place was not only relaxing but has a comforting environment.. The server was extremely friendly and super attentive! The owner even came out to greet us for coming in! This place is a must if you love mediterranean foods. The gyro was super good and don't skimp on the meat :) this is probably the best gyro I've eaten in a long time and plus it's close to home!  I highly recommend trying this place out and don't forget to order that hummus!

Reviews.Author: Mindy
Reviews.Content: This is my 2nd visit to Hummus Factory. Excellent food, and great service. We were greeted by Niki, and Penny was our server. My girlfriend & I ordered salads with an appetizer of zucchini fries. Everything was delicious. My friend ordered falafel on her salad, which is not an option on the menu. Penny accepted the order then went to the kitchen to figure out a way to add falafel. Penny never mentioned it wasn't an option. Anything is possible right? That's the service you get here. Plus the food is amazing, enjoy!

Reviews.Author: Felix
Reviews.Content: Best Mediterranean food in Vegas. I've had both the shawarma plate and sandwich. The sandwich comes with fries which can be upgraded to various options.   Very clean and modern decor. Staff was super friendly and accommodating.  The ambiance is nice enough for a date but not over the top for a casual outing.   Will have to come back to try some other items off the menu.

Reviews.Author: Samuel
Reviews.Content: This place is just amazing! And the Greek burger is my favorite burger in town. The service is really good. This is my second time here and I've had the shrimp kabob which is amazing , also the lamb chops are to die for . The chef/cook tony came out talked to me and my group of 7 told us a little about his business and took pictures with us , even though he was really busy he takes his time to make sure all the customers are happy. Hand down one of my favorite restaurants in town!

Reviews.Author: Lisa
Reviews.Content: I ordered carry out so I can't rate on table service but the whole carry out experience was wonderful. While placing my order I was informed of a new habanero hummus they had. I tried it and loved it!  Very spicy so if you're not into a lot of heat stay away. Also got a Greek salad. It was very large & fresh. The dressing had a hint of sweetness I could have done without but not a deal breaker. From phone to pickup everyone was very polite, informative,prompt & correct on entire order. On my list for a go back & dine in.

Reviews.Author: Hanley
Reviews.Content: My family went here for a graduation lunch. We had a group of 12 or 13 people but the servers were very accomdating. Service was fast and the food was delicious. Overall everyone had a positive experience and enjoyed our time there. We'll be back.

Reviews.Author: Patricia
Reviews.Content: Excellent service friendly staff, the food was fresh and delicious. Nice interior. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Author: Sue
Reviews.Content: This place was fantastic.  The food, the presentation and the service all exceeded expectations. I had the falafel plate with the lentil soup. I was expecting the typical plate but it arrived in a bowl with lots of veggies - very pretty presentation as well as tasty. Also had the baklava and liked the unique presentation of that as well. Definitely will make this a regular spot.

Reviews.Author: Nicole
Reviews.Content: Hands down the best Mediterranean food in Las Vegas! I'm middle eastern and I love my grandmas cooking. I was very excited to try this out! I ordered to go, everyone was very friendly and welcoming. We ordered the fried zucchinis, gyro sandwiches, shrink scampi, and the hummus with beef! ABSOLUTELY impressed! I will definitely be back! Great establishment! I highly recommend

Reviews.Author: Sharman
Reviews.Content: Tried it after being open less than 2 wks. Was disappointed they didn't have their liquor license yet to enjoy a glass of wine with dinner. Food was very flavorful. Decor and ambiance was great away from that front window area. Loved the Baba ganoush and never had to ask for more bread. The salad was great too but too large. Share one next time. The kibbe was not at all what I have had all of my life - very different flavor of herbs and somewhat dry. I'd try something else next time. Service was way above average, especially in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Author: Pam
Reviews.Content: We came in late very close to closing and the service was excellent! The hummus was amazingly delicious don't forget to order some! We ordered a bunch of appetizers and there was not a bad one in the bunch. The large salad could could easily feed 4 people with some appetizers. This is a great family owned restaurant.

Reviews.Author: Michele
Reviews.Content: Loved this place.  Great service... Clean...But most of all... The food is awesome. Try the Eggplant fries. Amazing. I didn't have the heart to tell my seven year old grandson that he was eating  vegetables . He gobbled them up. I'll be back and I'll recommend to my friends.

Reviews.Author: Cynthia
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to say we had lunch here today. I have to say this restaurant was amazing! The waitress Alida was so , so nice and very prompt with serving the larger than expected portions of food plus the  restaurant was very clean.  I would recommend the Hummus Factory to anyone who enjoys Mediterranean food. Cynthia:)))))

Reviews.Author: Michael
Reviews.Content: You have to try their mezza! Love the sampler and the best taboulleh I have had in years.  Flavors are very distinctive and Taste like the first time I tried many of these items. You can taste the difference with fresh ingredients and people who love making food to savor and never want to end.  The hummus was mild and creamy.  I usually don't like cucumbers but their cucumber salad was wonderful!! Feta and olives were great.    We both had the falafel sandwich.  While I wasn't a huge fan of the kimchi, the falafel was perfect.  I opted for the zucchini fries which were a great upgrade option and well worth it.  Many places use frozen fries but these are made fresh with a light batter and great dipping sauce.  While I was gorged from the meal our server recommended a baked custard in puff pastry.  OMG it was beyond incredible.  Sprinkled with pistachios and honey it was light and just the amount of sweetness.  Service was also very good.  Very friendly and attentive - quick refills and great recommendations.

Reviews.Author: Ryan
Reviews.Content: Service is so friendly and the food is amazing! Menu has expanded from what Tony had on the food truck (same name) and the quality and flavor is superb! You will not leave here hungry as the serving portions are generous.   If you are on this side of town and want something other than fast food, this is the place to try! Mediterranean food at its finest.

Reviews.Author: Bobby
Reviews.Content: I've eaten here 6 or 7 times now, and I'm officially hooked.  *Perfect* falafel every time - crispy outside and just the right density on the inside. The chef here is a master of the falafel - this is not a simple achievement. One bite and you will be spoiled. The *only* other falafel in town that holds a candle to these are Amena Bakery's - and even so, you would never take a date to Amena. The Hummus Factory is the Total Wine of Mediterranean, and Amena is a downtown liquor store with a much smaller menu and barred windows (not really, but you know what I mean?) I can't think of anything that Amena does that The Hummus Factory can't do better.  Crazy good fresh hot pitas. Like should accompany your last-meal-on-Earth good. If you're going to cheat on your no-carb diet, you might as well do it here with absolutely no regrets.  They've also concocted the *best* Greek salad dressing of all time. And I was never one to be like,  Hmm, for lunch I'm feeling like a Greek salad...  But now I totally am. This Greek salad changes everything (see my Yelp photo) and it's a once-a-week choice for me when I'm in town.  All three items I've mentioned (the falafel, pitas, and Greek salad) are best-in-class in Las Vegas, and will set you up for disappointment when you order these things anywhere else. It's happened to me several times in the last month on the East Coast. Even my favorite Mediterranean place in Atlanta (where I lived for 7 years) is no longer good to me.  As a bonus, the current check-in offer with a dinner entrée is a complimentary plate of signature hummus - again, a exemplary rendition tastefully garnished with cucumber wedges at 3, 6, 9, and 12. Delicious stuff!

Reviews.Author: Carlos
Reviews.Content: From the minute you walk in the staff issuer nice and the FOOD omg pictures don't do it justice!! It's a must try!!! The lemonade is a must

Reviews.Author: Obie
Reviews.Content: First time here and from start to finish I was very impressed. Staff was very friendly and accommodating. The food was delicious and was very satisfied. I ordered the Frarej which is a recipe they've had in their family for 50 years. Loved it.

Reviews.Author: Emily
Reviews.Content: Everyone who works there is so friendly. The food is great and I love all the side options they give for their entrees!

Reviews.Author: Suzanne
Reviews.Content: The food is awesome and the service is great. My favorite is the Fatoosh salad with chicken, salmon or shrimp, eggplant fries and jalapeno hummus.

Reviews.Author: Suzette
Reviews.Content: The jalapeño hummus is amazing!    Chicken kabobs are awesome!!  Nicely decorated and great service.   Alida was our amazing waitress.!!! We come here at least once o twice a week.  A family favorite.

Reviews.Author: Mijo
Reviews.Content: We have been waiting for this place to open and when it did we enjoyed every minute of being there. The costumer service was great. Not only did the food come out quickly, it was delicious! Hard to pick my favorite dish because it was all so yummy. Definitely get the hummus - duh! I will be going again soon!

Reviews.Author: Marla
Reviews.Content: LOVE! LOVE! LOVE! Like I posted on Facebook.. my new fav!  Atmosphere, ((food)) & the people, will keep me coming back! Recommending to all my friends!  #SooooGoood!

Reviews.Author: Lee
Reviews.Content: This place is amazing, best kafta plate i've ever had. The hummus and tabouli are fantastic, the restaurant has a bistro vibe, 10 out of 10......also make sure you are hungrey, the portions are hearty and filling!!!!

Reviews.Author: Steve
Reviews.Content: We found this place by accident. Everything was really good. George took good care of us. We live across town & will make an effort to come back

Reviews.Author: Travis
Reviews.Content: Wow... is all I have to say. Came here for lunch today before class and my girlfriend and I were amazed. I had the beef and chicken kabob combo while she had the chicken shawarma. My combo was amazing. Came with rice, one beef kabob, one chicken kabob, onions, and side of hummus and pita. The hummus and pita were amazing! I love their herb butter with my pita. The kabobs were cooked well and had a nice amount of seasoning on it. All the herbs blended into a nice taste. The shawarma was good according to my girlfriend and it came with zucchini fries. GET THE ZUCCHINI FRIES!!! It just melts in your mouth. Hands down my favorite thing there now.   As far as pricing it's within the $10-$18 price range and you get a good sized portion. Lunch and dinner prices differ so watch for that.  The lady who served us was very friendly and maintained amazing service the whole time. Wish we remembered her name, but she was a nice Asian lady. Overall this place was a good spot to eat and we will be back again for sure.

Reviews.Author: Megan
Reviews.Content: Not your typical Mediterranean cuisine! The jalapeño hummus is fantastic but definitely has a kick of spicy! Salads are great! Crisp lettuce with fresh ingredients and nice spices. I did not love the lentil appetizer but everything else was great! Excited to try more. Restaurant was clean with cute, industrial restaurant equipment used to inspire decor.

Reviews.Author: Eli
Reviews.Content: Love this place so glad I don't have to stalk them around town and even better they opened 1 block from where I work on Mondays so I go frequently. Portions have always been huge always need a to go box. Tried the pretzel sliders, factory burger, chicken kabobs and regular hummus all SOOOOO good. I have wanted to upgrade and try both of the other types of fries but I always end up spending the extra $$ on hummus and pita bread because I feel empty without it. Restaurant is nice and clean. I usually go during less busy times so I haven't had long waits. Waitresses have been very nice every time. Service always good first time there they were out of pretzel bread so they nicely came over and let me know and apologized which is all I ask for no biggie I had like a list of things I needed to try so I moved on to the next one. Great place! Hope it succeeds.

Reviews.Author: Juddi
Reviews.Content: Well all I have to say it Hummus Factory out did themselves again! From food truck to restaurant.. All I could say is that the food truck was delicious but the restaurant is even better! Not only the place is extremely clean, amazing atmosphere, great customer service but the place is very well designed.. Don't forget to try their kabobs. Their kabobs are to die for! I would to say it is really nice to know that the owner of this joint takes pride in this restaurant.. You can tell with all the details they put in to it. I will definitely come back again and again and again!

Reviews.Author: T
Reviews.Content: I have been to The Hummus Factory twice since it opened.  The service is fantastic. The server (not sure what his name is) has a genuine smile and very polite. I always tip him very well because he works hard and truly deserves it.  Price range is pretty competitive with others in the city (example Paymon's). The decor is quite interesting as it doesn't read Mediterranean although it is very well kept and clean. I will say that my first visit during the summer almost killed me; the air conditioning either wasn't working or they just didn't turn it on to save on electricity. It was way too warm and I was sat way in the back of the restaurant by the back entrance when there was no one else in the restaurant.  The second time around it was still slightly warm but much cooler than the first time.    The eggplant and zucchini fries are huge portions and are cut slightly too big for my taste. I think they would be crispier if they were cut slightly smaller. The portions are big and remind me of CheeseCake Factory sizes, very rare to find this in Mediterranean restaurants.    Overall, I definitely recommend this place perhaps in the fall and winter when it's cooler unless they worked on the A/C system. The service is excellent, food is pretty consistent...Also, I happened to catch a wild Pickachu playing Pokemon Go in the restaurant as I waited for my food.  That itself is 2 stars alone!!!!!

Reviews.Author: Norm
Reviews.Content: Although limited in my experience with Mediterranean food, I have to go all in for the Hummus Factory with the 5 stars.  Two of us came here to share various items.  The restaurant had few customers at 5 PM on Friday night.  We ordered:  Factory hummus order and pita (free with Yelp check in) Falafel appetizer with fresh vegetables and tahini sauce Meat combination with one beef kabob, one kafta, one sujuk and one kibbi with baba ghanoush (susbstiution of zucchini fries for rice for an upcharge) Gyro sandwich (substitute eggplant fries instead of rice for an upcharge) Baklava Rice pudding Shabiet  I ordered an iced tea also and was brought refills several times without needing to ask.  I also asked if I could sample their ghost pepper sauce that you can get with hummus.  Our server, Nikki, brought a small cup of the sauce and warned me to only dip the pita in a little bit of the sauce.  That's what I did and immediately started hiccuping from the reaction to the heat of the ghost pepper.  I won't be eating that--it is very hot as I guessed it would be.  First off before trying the ghost pepper sauce, we were brought an order of hummus and very hot, house made pita bread.  Both were excellent.  The pita was so light and fluffy in texture.  It was with a small piece of the pita that I tries the ghost pepper sauce.  We also had a small round of butter that was flavorful with the pita.  Next up came the falafel appetizer.  Good falafels with good tasting tahini and a selection of fresh vegetables to go with the falafel.  Next came our two main courses.  One was a gyro sandwich with zucchini fries and one was the meat combination with eggplant fries and an order of baba ghanoush.  Of the fries, the eggplant were better to my taste although the zucchini were good, too.  Good gyro.  The meat combination was very good.  Standout on this dish was the sujuk--spicy sausage.  The spice was perfect for this meat.  We ended our meal with 3 desserts, baklava, rice pudding, and shabiet.  The baklava is much different than I've had before.  There is honey but it's not dripping or swimming in honey.  In addition, it's small in width and shaped like a piece of Kit Kat.  Very tasty and a different way of making it.  The rice pudding was quite creamy and very good and last, the shabiet with its ashta cream was very good.  The shabiet is shaped like a turnover and has this wonderful cream inside.  Part of my five stars also is for the service.  Our factory worker, Nikki, was really a pleasant woman who was quite interesting to speak with and she was always there to refill iced tea or my companion's water glass.  It's quite a story that this brick and mortar restaurant came about after its start as a food truck restaurant.

Reviews.Author: Shari
Reviews.Content: The jalapeño hummus is FABULOUS. The veggies Are fresh and I am loving this place. THE LENTIL SOUP is delicious.  The restaurant is very cool.  Staff is very attentive. Looks like I'm going to be camping out here for a while.  Music not too loud great ambiance  Looking forward to trying the shawarma and my fav vegetarian stuffed dolmas

Reviews.Author: Evalesha
Reviews.Content: The Hummus Factory is the perfect place to have a quiet lunch by yourself or to catch up with an old friend. Each time I have visited, they are never overcrowded and the service is always amazing. I never know what to order when I eat out and they are never short on suggestions.  Today we tried the jalapeño hummus, which is all the yum! I love spicy food and thought the jalapeño was relatively mild so I ordered the ghost pepper hummus to take home to my fiancé. YIKES! The flavor is amazing but shortly after your first bite, the ghost peppers smack you right in the face. I'll stick with the jalapeño next time. I also ordered a greek salad with salmon and split it with my friend. The salmon was fresh and cooked perfectly. The salad was gigantic! Needless to say, we came hungry and left satisfied.  I'll definitely keep coming to The Hummus Factory!

Reviews.Author: Xenia
Reviews.Content: The Factory Hummus was really good with fresh from the oven pita! Portions are huge so consider sharing. All the staff are extremely friendly. Atmosphere is relaxing and calm. Definitely going back to try more things on the menu.

Reviews.Author: Sara
Reviews.Content: I have been working a lot lately so I don't get much time to go to a restaurant and have been trying to eat healthier but once in a while get a craving for something like a gyro.   I ordered a gyro, with only tomatoes and meat to go. Fries are included.   Pros: *lady in front was friendly  *white linen tablecloths   Cons: *bunch of stuff in front of cash register  *was given a falafel with everything on it. good thing I checked before leaving parking lot *in my already busy day, had to wait for 2 orders  *have had better pitas and gyro meat *don't prefer fries with added seasoning  There are at least 3 better Mediterranean restaurants in the Vegas area. Sadly, this one isn't on my return list.

Reviews.Author: Heather
Reviews.Content: Factory Hummus, zucchini Fries, gyros... yummmmmm! Nice location, quick service, the inside is calm. The pink sauce is Sriracha and mayo, good, but a little spicy for me.  In general, this is an amazing place, the staff is really friendly!

Reviews.Author: Naren
Reviews.Content: Delicious food. Homemade bread. Great service. And open late. The house chicken dish is fantastic!

Reviews.Author: J
Reviews.Content: A friend suggested Hummus Factory because it was near Desert Breeze, and we're really glad we took her suggestion!   We started with the Labni Mattoum, Mazon's suggestion over the regular Labni, and it was enormous.  My husband had the beef shwarma sandwich, with fries, and I had the falafel plate with a side of hummus. I had originally ordered the vegetarian grape leaves, but they were out :(. The falafel was served on a bed of colorful assorted vegetables, and they were excellent dipped in the hummus. I took most of the veggies home because it was just too much food, and made a baladi salad with fresh tomatoes the next day.  If we lived closer, this would be a go-to spot.

Reviews.Author: Syd
Reviews.Content: All their food is homemade. It was amazing! Their half chicken takes a little time to make but is worth the wait. One of the best meals I have had ! The friendliest staff and very attentive ! They give big portions so no one leaves hungry. Very happy and will definitely be back soon !

Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: I'll give it a 3 because the servers were attentive, the place was clean and the hummus was really good.  The other food, not so much.  The lentil soup was pretty watery and the beef shwarma had a really odd sweet coating.  I have never tasted any shwarma like that before.  It didn't suit me and I couldn't finish it.  I'm sure it was well prepared, just not prepared in a way that I have ever tasted in any Middle-Eastern/Greek restaurant.  It tasted like something I should get at Teriyaki Madness.  So I won't be back.

Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: Food was way to salty!!! The pita bread is fresh and taste good-the hummus was pretty good. The only bad thing is the salt level of each dish after eating I was drinking water like crazy because of the dehydration

Reviews.Author: Pat
Reviews.Content: Just had an early dinner there and it was truly awful.  We had the factory hummus with home made pita which was great. Everything else was grossly over seasoned.  We split a kabob combo meal of chicken and steak with a factory salad.  The salad would've been good had it not had a ton of thyme or some other herb, making it almost inedible.  The steak was overcooked and chicken was overwhelmingly seasoned with a mustard type seasoning.  The rice it was sitting on was also tart and terribly over seasoned.  We didn't finish our meals and no one inquired as to why when we said we wouldn't like a to go box.  I wanted to tell the server all this, but he didn't hang around long enough to even pull aside.

Reviews.Author: Barbara
Reviews.Content: Ok so we went back and tried it several times. The fatoush is consistent but the lubeah not so much. Grape leaves really not good and hummus is not a smooth consistently. The chicken swarma is good. Ethnic restaurants need to be consistent if they want return customers.

Reviews.Author: Val
Reviews.Content: This little hummus gem is wonderful! Friendly staff, comfy n clean atmosphere and delectable food! Highly recommended! We had the special hummus, the Scorpion hummus, the house salad, the factory hummus, the 3 meat combo and the kibbi platter. All very very tasty n packing with flavor!!!!  Super awesome place! A must try and definitely future return customers!

Reviews.Author: Tomasa
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best Mediterranean restaurants I have ever been to. The food looks and tastes delicious. The place is clean and has great service, the servers are very tentative, and they make sure you enjoy your meal. I will be bringing my friends and family here. I was looking for a healthy place and found it while driving by. This place has lots of gluten free and vegetarian options. The hummus is amazing!!!

Reviews.Author: Tom
Reviews.Content: I'm more than a little puzzled that yet another Mediterranean restaurant has located itself in an area that is already loaded with them. The Hummus Factory, Hedary, Paymons, Zaytoon, Maza, and some others are located within the same general area, in some cases within a few blocks of each other. The Hummus factory menu is very similar to Hedary, so I ordered what I often get at Hedary:  Kafta skewers and lentil soup.  I have no complaints about what I got. It was good, but it wasn't as good as Hedary. The rice was OK but not as good as Hedary's (which is excellent). The pita bread, too, was good and fresh, but not as good as Hedary. Hedary is just a couple of blocks away from Hummus Factory, so I'll go there. To respond to owner's comment: I agree with your reference to Chinatown, so maybe the congregation of Mediterranean restaurants is a similar concept. However, regardless of the origination of the recipes, if you choose to locate your restaurant a few blocks from Hedary's, and maintain a similar menu, you should expect your restaurant to be compared directly to Hedary's. Even though I liked your food (3 stars), I do not think it equaled Hedary's.

Reviews.Author: Heidi
Reviews.Content: Me + The Hummus Factory = Love at First Taste.  My significant other and I had seen the Hummus Factory advertised on Instagram decided to give a try.  Upon arrival, the restaurant was quite empty but very clean.  I'm a stickler for using real utensils, plates, glasses, and napkins and The Hummus Factory did not disappoint!  The young lady who seated us was tremendously helpful, friendly, and thankful for our business.  She helped us as we ordered, offering suggestions on great dishes to try, as well as ways we could include add-ons etc.    We started with complimentary Pita Bread, which ended up being my absolute favorite thing there.  It was WARM, FRESH, and the smell brought me right back to my grandmother's kitchen.  The herb spread that came with it was out of this world.    We chose the Factory Hummus for our appetizer.  I'm not a huge hummus fan but my significant other talked me into it -- it did NOT disappoint!  If all hummus was like this hummus, I would be a hummus fiend!    For our main meals, I ended up ordering a Gyro Sandwich (amazing flavor!) and my significant other ordered the Chicken Kabobs (scrumptious!).  The Chicken Kabobs came with a side salad, which was so good I actually took over eating it for my significant other lol.    The portions were HUGE and our eyes were larger than our stomachs that day, which meant we had seconds for lunch the next day (#winning).  Aside from the great food, service was amazing.  It was refreshing to go to a restaurant where the employees seemed to genuinely care about the patrons.    I would recommend the Hummus Factory to anyone looking for a pleasant dining experience that involves tantalizing food.

Reviews.Author: Kyle
Reviews.Content: This place is amazing Greek burger and Greek fries are my favorites give it a try or you're missing out

Reviews.Author: Hay
Reviews.Content: Upon being seated, I told the server that I had a yelp check-in for hummus and she came back 3 mins later to tell me they were out of hummus. I said  you're out of hummus at the hummus factory?  - totally meant to be funny and sarcastic, but she felt so terrible about it. She told me she'd remember me for next time since I already put down that I used the free hummus coupon. Next thing you know the chef/owner comes out to let us know he can make hummus for us, but it will take about 10 mins. 10 mins later he brings it to us and apologizes that it would taste better if it was refrigerated (allowing the flavors to marinate as the hummus cools).   Honestly, it is one of the best hummus I've ever had. It tasted fresh (obviously) and it was delicious and creamy. I'd recommend their hummus to everyone. Homemade hummus is the best hummus.   Their pita - so delicious, chewy and really fresh. I love pita and always find Mediterranean restaurants use packaged pita or day old pita and it always leaves my mouth feeling dry. Their pita is served with their house-made butter which is very herbaceous. A+.  Their chicken shawarma - it really actually tasted like chicken fajita. Don't get me wrong, I love fajita so I really didn't mind, but I honestly wouldn't call that shawarma to be honest. It was still delicious though! Just wish it had more Mediterranean spices.  Their fried zucchini - could use some time in the oven. Some of it came to us pretty soggy, but the breading was delicious. Their aioli was really good as well!  Their baba ganoush - nice tartness to it. I loved the taste and the portion was pretty good! It tasted good with the fries.  I ordered their chicken shawarma plate and got fries (+$1.95) instead of their rice. The fries worked well with the hummus. I wish I had garlic sauce. That would have been top notch.   Overall, service was good. I hope they don't become like other restaurants around here that lose sight of what's important. I will be frequenting this place and am excited about it!

Reviews.Author: J
Reviews.Content: Their reputation precedes them with their food truck so I had to try it when they opened their restaurant at a former deli.  I've been to both dinner and lunch service, and was equally impressed with the food and service both times.  Pita bread is served pillowy and when punctured, it lets  out a puff of steam. Paired with the Factory Hummus,  it's even better.  The falafel appetizer is generously portioned and perfectly crisp. The veggies underneath offset the density that falafel can sometimes have. I had the beef schwarma sandwich. Once there was a tad too much tahini, but I scraped the excess away to make it better. The kafta is evenly seasoned and was mild enough for my son to eat too.  If I had to find fault with one thing, they plate so much vegetables - lettuce, cucumbers, etc. - on most of their dishes, that I feel like they could save some money giving a little less. I love my veggies, but i don't think their customers would notice or mind if they held back a little.  Our lunch waiter was extremely attentive but not hovering. Dinner was served by Niki (owner) and her daughter. Again, they were attentive and wonderful conversationalists.   Can't say how great it is to have a family-owned restaurant to keep going back to in the neighborhood.

Reviews.Author: Jason
Reviews.Content: We ordered the factory hummus, chicken kabobs, and a chicken gyro. Portions are large and the food was fantastic. Very flavorful.

Reviews.Author: Margeaux
Reviews.Content: Shared Labni Matoom, Kabob Combo (chicken and beef), and factory salad. Everything is so fresh and flavorful.The bread came out straight from the oven piping hot!  Perfect lunch for a sweltering hot Las Vegas afternoon. I will definitely go back and try other dishes on the menu.

Reviews.Author: Michael
Reviews.Content: Items Selected: Housemade Pita with Herb Butter Factory Hummus - Garbanzo Beans, Lemon Juice, Garlic, Sesame and Olive Oil Baba Ganoosh - Smoked Egglplant, Garlic, Tahini, Lemon Juice Falafil - Cucumbers, Olives, Tomatoes, Tahini, Housemade Pickles Ghost Pepper Puree Gyro with Zucchini Fries and Pink Sauce Combination Plate - Beef Kabob, Kafta, Sujuk, Kibbi with Eggplant Fries and Pink Sauce Baklava - Filo Pastry, Walnuts, Sugar, Sweet Butter Shabiet - Filo Pastry, Milk Custard, Honey, Crushed Pistachios Rice Pudding - Rosewater and Pistachio  Located on West Sahara Avenue, an area that seems to be growing by leaps and bounds with Eatt and Paradise India recently showing signs of life, The Hummus Factory from Tony Tabet represents the first Brick and Mortar location for a former Food Truck that gathered fans by way of delivering healthy Mediterranean fusion in a scene typically dominated by fried fare, tacos and burgers with odd toppings.  Bearing no association to Hummus Factory's elsewhere, the restaurant owned by Tabet and his wife's only  relation  being that the Chef's Aunt brought Khoury's Mediterranean to Las Vegas several years ago, The Hummus Factory occupies a lengthy space just West of Buffalo Drive and with seating for a tepproximately eighty stretching backward from a foyer flanked by a bar that displays the open kitchen the restaurant takes on a sort of non-descript feel that does little to convey its ethnicity by way of several pieces of art designed by the owners themselves, the music a bit more appropriate to the style of the menu, though at times the chants or singing do become a touch too loud.  Serving large portions across the menu, Mrs. Tabet acting as Maitre D' and waitress explaining that the goal was to feed people as it is done back home, prices trend  higher than most of the Valley's Mediterranean options in part due to the fact that almost everything offered is meant for sharing, the ability to order samplers and substitutions a welcome addition for those who do not wish to fill up on rice with the average cost for a meal-for-two probably somewhere in the range of fifty dollars.  Dining as a duo with a goal to sample widely from sections ranging from dips and salads to sandwiches and entrees, it was with a few questions asked that the order was settled, a substantial three-course tasting comprised of approximately nine items with an all-in cost of just under $90.  Beginning with house-made Pita, certainly one of the best in the city with four fluffy puffs per basket, round one consisted of the restaurant's eponymous dish that offers a creamy base with light herbs gently slicked in Olive Oil with an underlying bit of Citrus, the oddly spelled  Falafil  appetizer getting away from the neon green hues of some with a dense nuttiness that plays well off Tahini and housemade Pickles, the Baba Ganoosh another great flavor that does wonders for anything it is spread on by adding its satin texture as well as a touch of smoke.  Chuckling at the ridiculousness of Ghost Peppers, perhaps 1/8tsp causing a spontaneous cough and hiccupping fit from one at the table, it was with palates ready that more meaty options arrived for round two of the evening, the Gyro relatively standard fare flanked by gently fried slices of Zucchini (a $2.95 addition) that paired well with the sweet n' savory  Pink Sauce,  while the Combination Plate was a far more fulfilling option highlighted by Spicy Sujuk and reference standard Kibbi alongside Eggplant fries that will leave all but the most strong-willed picking at them until the pile is reduced to nothing.  Offering three desserts, each charged $6.95 with everything, again, made in-house, The Hummus Factory's Baklava is quite different from the standard in that each of the five fingers is only lightly touched in sweetness and thus extremely crunchy with a focus on the Walnuts and strips of Phyllo, a more traditional Rice Pudding dialing up savory notes with Rosewater and Cinnamon playing off Pistachios while the warm Shabiet happily steals the spotlight by way of creamy Custard tucked inside layers of crisp Pastry beneath a veil of Nuts and Honey.  ****Priced a bit steeply for what it is, though taking the time to do everything from scratch no doubt warrants a premium for labor as well as skill, The Hummus Factory proves that the transition from Truck to Restaurant remains as possible as ever in the current restaurant climate, though the space itself could still use a bit of work before it feels like it has a true identity while dishes better suited for solo diners would be welcomed as well.

Reviews.Author: Kristine
Reviews.Content: Sahara has every average fast food chain, it's awash I. The typical stereotypes- until now! I first came upon The Hummus Factory at the Foodie Fest when I first moved here two years ago.  Truth be told, I only went for White Castle.  That's correct, White Castle born and raised on it! I'm from Long Island or 'Lawn Gyland' ha! Now, the first item I tried from The Hummus Factory food truck (yes, in NY these are called 'something else' insert laughing emoji please) was the eggplant fries and instantly became addicted. I then ordered three more orders that day and brought them home. My other favorite is baba Ganosh- it's damn tasty here! My third favorite- Greek Burger.   This will now be a weekly stop for me!

Reviews.Author: Doug
Reviews.Content: This was a total surprise. Beautiful restaurant. Beautiful food. The hummus was A+ - We had the jalapeño. Had a pretty amazing salad. Everything tasted extremely clean. The chicken kabobs had a really nice lemon taste. Just overall exceptional and exceeded our expectations. Definitely check it out.

Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: Miss the truck? Get over to the restaurant. Hummus Factory is awesome.   The bread 5 stars The chicken kabobs 5 stars The babaganush 5 stars  The lamb chops 5 stars  And did I mention the bread.

Reviews.Author: Henry
Reviews.Content: first time been in this restaurant.... it has great mediterranean food.... friendly staffs and excellent service... plus free wifi so we could eat and social...

Reviews.Author: Pamela
Reviews.Content: Probably the best hummus in Vegas along with delicious salads and grilled meats. Great choice! Yum

Reviews.Author: Mandy
Reviews.Content: Amazing amazing amazing! My friend had the kabobs who he where the best EVER! The gyro meat was so tender and the eggplant fries blew my mind! Chef Tony even came out to greet us! The food truck was rated best in Vegas, but the brick and mortar joint is even better!

Reviews.Author: Ifat
Reviews.Content: Since my husband and I discovered this restaurant we cannot get enough of it. We've been back already 5 times since it opened. The food is so authentic and delicous. The staff are so welcoming. I give them 5 stars. Can't wait to get back already and we were just there last night! Love, love, love this place! Best middle eastern restaurant in Vegas PERIOD!!!!

Reviews.Author: Kara
Reviews.Content: We had the mezze platter and everything was excellent! Got the shrimp too and it was perfect and the rice so yummy. The food is so fresh and the flavors so bold and amazing! This is by far the best hummus I have had in Vegas. The prices are great too. Nice casual atmosphere and the place is absolutely spotless.

Reviews.Author: Becky
Reviews.Content: THIS PLACE IS ABSOLUTELY AMAZING!!!!!! The food was great and the service was spectacular! I definitely recommend this place!!!!!

Reviews.Author: Cristine
Reviews.Content: Great customer service! My boyfriend and I got the chicken shawarma sandwich and it was so good. I will definitely be coming back.

Reviews.Author: Anne
Reviews.Content: One of our favorite traditions is to try different Mediterranean restaurants when we travel. We were vacationing in Las Vegas and just had to try the Hummus Factory for dinner.  Our waitress was Tory T. She was very pleasant, helpful and gave us great service.  We ended up getting the Mini Mezza (because we just couldn't decide on just one entree) with Shabiet for dessert.  Everything was very fresh and tasty!.  Our only regret is that it is so far away that it will be a while before we can get back there to try more of their fantastic food!  The only suggestion we have is to add an appetizer of Kibbi - it would be a great choice for either of the Mezza plates.

Reviews.Author: Christian
Reviews.Content: This restaurant has generated some hype but the food doesn't live up to it. I've been to Lebanon, so nothing can beat the heavenly hummus made in its region of origin. The piping hot bread at H Factory hits the spot but the hummus is just average. The kafta was dry unfortunately, the chicken shawarma lacked authentic spices and was a mess to eat. The zucchini fries were a hit but there is better hummus, sharwarma and koobideh elsewhere in Vegas.

Reviews.Author: Matthew
Reviews.Content: I might just give my right leg for their absolutely amazing jalepeno hummus. The bread that they serve with it is nothing short of glorious, warm, fluffy yet perfectly crisp, and is freshly made. The gyro's are out of this world and the amount of fries they give you fill you up beyond capacity. Very friendly and welcoming staff, exceptional food, and calm atmosphere. Love this place!

Reviews.Author: Marvin
Reviews.Content: The food was really Amazing, and the Service was even more amazing. I luv our server her name is Happy,  see her and enjoy the food and the wonderful service.

Reviews.Author: Vanja
Reviews.Content: Today I went to hummus factory for the first time. I was amazed how regular office place can be turned into a really cute restaurant with a lot of details picture vintage stuff. We got free Factory hummus with fluffy, hot, the best pita bread I have ever tried. Unlike other Mediterranean places where they gonna give you pita that you can buy in Walmart and heat it up this pita bread looked like homemade.  Since I'm a big salad lover I ordered Fatoosh without any meat just greens.  It was super delicious. A lot of flavors, well seasoned I loved pieces of Lebanese bread in it which wen great with those hummus leftovers we had - not a lot may I say.  I had a few bites of eggplant fries from my companions plate - Yum! We were offered with desert and Lebanese coffee (which I highly recommend to any coffee lover). Check out this place I loved it!

Reviews.Author: Reina
Reviews.Content: Passed by this place almost everyday going home from work and I finally convinced my loving S.O. to try it. The place wasn't pack when we got there, it was lunch time on a Monday. The facade is homey and everything is clean. The staff was friendly and very accommodating. Now, to the food. The bread/pita: goodness! See, here's the thing, my S.O. has had always this endearing issue that his food must be always hot when it get's to him. Whenever he see  his order, he actually count the minutes on how long it was there on the counter before serving it to him and if it's lukewarm or col to his  standards  he will not be happy. And this bread/pita, burned his fingers. He was so happy.  I loved the baba ganoush for my appetizer. Creamy and savory, the perfect pair for the bread. while my S.O. ordered Greek Fries, and goodness was it good and was it plenty. Served in a deep bowl, with feta crumble, it was good hot, crispy and fantastic! The tzatziki, or the cucumber sauce/gyro sauce was a perfect accompaniment for the fries.George, our server, recommended the pink sauce for it, and yes he was spot on. For the main dish, I ordered the Gyro sandwich with egg plant fries. It was fantastic, especially the egg plant fries. Crunchy, light and creamy, amazing. The Gyro sandwich was great as well. Filling but not heavy. My S.O. went for the pretzel sliders which he adored and again was served with an abundant serving of fries.  After about 20 mins, we're so stuffed that we had to have three boxes, which was great for dinner.   i went the second time with my sister, and this girl is in love with their Dolmas and Majadra. Again, I must relieve the craving for the Egg plant fries and pink sauce. Also the Mini Mezza was plenty for a comfortable filling dinner. Definitely, will go here again.

Reviews.Author: Hugs
Reviews.Content: Fabulous..fresh and delish..spoiled  by Chicago  pita inn..this equals or is even better!  I am now addicted!  Tell your friends..a great new Mediterranean  restaurant with favorite items..yum yum!

Reviews.Author: Denees
Reviews.Content: THE Best Mediterranean with a twist food I have ever tasted! I mean do you think it's obsessive that we have eaten here 4 times with 1 time take away? Maybe that's not a lot to you, but I am talking 5 times in 3 weeks. shrimp scampi... the bomb, Greek fries delicious, vegetarian dolmades perfect little finger food! And the ghost pepper hummus, so good that I used the small amount that wasn't noshed, in a vinaigrette dressing for my salad the next day. The puffed up, fresh out of the oven pita... Ahh the smell is divine. Lebanese coffee and desserts sooo good, I have to plan my meal around making a little room for the goodies. All the food we have tried is exploding with flavor.  The atmosphere is so chill I feel completely relaxed from the outside world. I think it's my new happy place!  The staff is very sweet and the chef usually comes out and delivers food to the table, last time he hooked me up with perfectly sweetened Lebanese coffee. Nothing is better than feeling the love and care in the food your eating.

Reviews.Author: Kim
Reviews.Content: This place is great! Love the hummus. 10/10 would return. The kafta is like a Persian koobehdeh which is my favorite item on the menu. Also can't forget the fresh pita that is always being given to you. One of my favorite Mediterranean spots in town!

Reviews.Author: Josie
Reviews.Content: Hands down the best gyro in town. The homemade pita is amazing and all of the sauces have different delightful flavors. Try the Turkish coffee!

Reviews.Author: Bret
Reviews.Content: Stopped in for lunch and had a gyro sandwich. It came with a heaping portion of fries. It was the best gyro I've had in a while. I'm definitely coming back here.

Reviews.Author: AnaRose
Reviews.Content: Our dining experience here was perfect. Service was awesome. Ambiance is lively but calming and comfortable. The music was a nice touch to the Mediterranean food experience. Food tasted great!   We will definitely come back!

Reviews.Author: Melissa
Reviews.Content: Greek salad is amazing and huge!! It's the best in town! Was hoping they had shawarma, maybe next time. Food had good flavor and big portions.

Reviews.Author: Richard
Reviews.Content: The food is fresh and really good. Definitely will make this a frequent stop. They were kinda slow but service was great.

Reviews.Author: I.
Reviews.Content: First, I want to say that the young female server was so nice and friendly. Also, I believe it was the owner who stopped by our table as well, who was very sweet. They made our experience that much better.   The food is great. We ordered a lot of things on the menu and they were all delicious. The highlights of the meal were the labni matoom, chicken kabobs, fatoosh, kibbi, and the shabiet dessert. Everything tasted authentic and had lots of flavor. If I had one critique, I would say the fried zucchini fries should be cut a little thinner. The flavor is all there, but unfortunately, since they were so thick, it was a little too squishy and took away from the taste. Nevertheless, we had an enjoyable experience and will definitely be back.

Reviews.Author: Brandy
Reviews.Content: The actual restaurant is set up nicely. The service was AMAZING!!! Our server helped with recommendations and everything was delicious.   We had the hummus appetizer, tried all of the salad options (except the house salad), and tried the kabobs and the half chicken dinner dish. Ever thing was delicious.   I personally had the kabobs, and the sauce on the rice and chicken was so good I ate the entire thing and couldn't get any dessert in :-(  I cannot wait to come back for dessert and to try their specialty coffee.

Reviews.Author: Foster
Reviews.Content: I was so happy when I saw this restaurant moving in the same shopping center as my work. It is now my go-to spot for lunch. So great to have a healthy and tasty option close by. I look forward to working my way through the menu. Everything has been amazing so far.

Reviews.Author: Krystal
Reviews.Content: Great food and service. Everything was beyond fresh and tasty. Will definitely be back

Reviews.Author: Stacy
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we've eaten here - by far the best Greek we've had in Las Vegas!

Reviews.Author: Diana
Reviews.Content: The food is so fresh, the place is so clean and the atmosphere is just amazing. Will be coming here again and frequent.

Reviews.Author: Sam
Reviews.Content: Great food and service! Portions were really large. We ordered the eggplant fries,  (and also got the zucchini at no charge :) the factory hummus, a Greek salad, shish kabobs and dolmas. Everything was super fresh and delicious! Great job, keep it up, we'll definitely be back!

Reviews.Author: Antoine
Reviews.Content: This is my second review, and unfortunately I have to take down two stars because of my last visit...First I am going to start with the positive: The place is nicely decorated, with a friendly atmosphere and good music. The food choices are wider than most Lebanese restaurants, offering more than the traditional menu offered everywhere. The quality is good and close to authentic, but since my previous visit, I had to change my opinion a little:  First, after a long wait, I received my order first; I thought the other two are on the way. As a courtesy, I decided to wait for my friend's food to arrive. By the time it arrived (20 mns later!), my food was cold and I could not enjoy it. Not only that, but I ordered the Beef Shawarma, and to my shock, I see what looked like thin slices of steak, instead of shredded beef as it is traditionally (and the ONLY way) served. When I tried it, it did not even taste like shawarma; the spices were not even close to the real thing. I have to say I was very disappointed, especially that I had a good experience on my previous visit, and the owner/chef is Lebanese so there is no excuse for not knowing the proper way to serve shawarma as it is one of our iconic dishes. My friend who also ordered and loved the Soujouk last time ordered it again but this time it was not the same...I did not want to give a bad review because I know they will fix this, and the place, being new probably is still tweaking everything like any new business, Hopefully they will work on how to serve the shawarma properly if they want to claim to have authentic Lebanese cuisine. It would have been the right thing also to offer not to charge my order since both waitresses were aware that I could not enjoy my food being cold; I did not want to make a big deal of it, but any respectable restaurant would offer at least that or some alternative... Also I read from another review that they take too long to bring the bread and the owner's answer was that it is because it is served fresh to order. In my opinion, the bread's freshness should not affect the service or quality of the food, so unless they can maintain the same quality and handle the pressure of traffic (which I hope they will have), then you can serve regular pre-made bread until then. Most restaurants do that and nobody complains, because it it the food quality and service that counts at the end; the fresh baked bread should only be an added bonus, but not at the expense of important things, because people will not go just for the bread but the overall experience, in my humble opinion. One last thing:  food should NEVER be served that far apart; most people will not start eating unless everyone is ready, so this is more of an etiquette issue than quality of food. I personally would have preferred to wait the extra 20 mns and enjoy my food WITH my friends than to stare at it then eat it cold... Despite everything, I still love the place and wish the owner all the luck; like every new business, it takes time to make everything perfect. that's why there are good and bad reviews, because this is how you improve. The servers are very friendly and I know the food is too in general, so I will definitely go back there and hope that this was a one-time experience and look forward for my next visit. (But PLEASE do not serve the shawarma like slices of steak; it is the whole point of shawarma! :) ).  Sorry for the long review, I did not want to present a negative one without giving the place the credit it deserves in other areas, I cannot wait to go again soon and give a much better rating!!

Reviews.Author: Amelia
Reviews.Content: Ok so this sucks that I have to give them 2 stars I would love to give them 5 but unfortunately due to a lack of customer service and not with the servers but more management so I have come in here atleast 6 times and I will say I love the food it's amazing haven't had a bad thing but I brought my husband in with me about two weeks ago after leaving he realized he forgot his hat I called it had been no more than 10 mins since we left the women on the phone said yes we have it Ill put it up for you I informed her I wouldn't be in to pick it up for a week she said no problem and we hung up I came in less than a week later and she instantly recognized me and said oh your hat let me grab it when she went to get it where she left it she found it was gone she asked everyone that was at work if they moved it no one said they had the manger than got involved first trying to tell me we don't have your hat no one ever called us about it basically saying I was lying than I said no this women here remembers she informed him yes this is true he than asked for my number so he could ask around and call he called me back about 2 hours later but I was at work and couldn't answer I than called him that same day and left him a message only for him to never return my call I came in a week later to grab lunch and find out what happen to my hat they told me they no idea about a hat and they don't have it the manger didn't even come out to speak with me even though I saw he was there they didn't discount my meal as an I'm sorry we lost or stole your hat obviously it's just a hat I will replace it but I was treated like I was lying given the runaround and was never even giving an apology it sucks cause I really do love it here and the day waitress is so sweet but I just don't know if I can return to a place that treats their customers this way 2 stars are for the day waitress I wish I knew her name and the food is good but there is great food everywhere  in vegas how I'm treated matters

Reviews.Author: Jerry
Reviews.Content: We went there for lunch. Ordered the hummus which was too lemony. Also had the Shish kabobs which had no taste the rice was bland the salad wasn't great. Beef stew wasn't good at all. What a way to spend almost 40 bucks on Lunch!!!!  Won't be coming here again!!

Reviews.Author: Drew
Reviews.Content: Gotta check this place out!! We stumbled upon it and were thrilled by the delicious food, cool atmosphere and great service. Seriously. Highly recommend!!

Reviews.Author: Lauren
Reviews.Content: Free hummus when you check in. It was a good size serving and very tasty too! The baba ganoush was delicious. I ordered the meat combo plate and everything was very tasty. The service was good too. Very nice and they answered all questions I had. Great place.

Reviews.Author: Art
Reviews.Content: Amazing amazing amazing! Such good, quality, fresh food. Compliments to the Chef and the whole service crew.  Priced great, perfect portions, great selection.   Highly recommend The Hummus Factory! Lunch and dinner.

Reviews.Author: Kristen
Reviews.Content: Wanted to try this place today and pulled up to find a taped up sign that said  gone fishing . Really? That's just terrible business. Sorry that fishing was more important than running your business during advertised business hours. Lame!

Reviews.Author: Milica
Reviews.Content: I took my sister here because she LOVES Mediterranean cuisine. We had the offer for free factory hummus and that came out immediately (thank god because we were hungry!) my sister ordered the fatoosh salad which was amazing! So flavorful and a huge portion size. It came out also immediately and we shared with the homemade pita and hummus. It took forever for my Greek burger and eggplant fries to come out. I was already full by the time it arrived and when it was ready it stood in the kitchen for another 10 minutes prior to it being served to me. I would expect next time both entrees to be delivered at the same time as that is the correct way to serve food. All in all, I love this place. The Greek burger was flavor packed with spices and sauces my tongue has never tasted before. The chefs are truly amazing. I would just fix the timing of the food for future reference.

Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: I give five stars because everything was in good alignment from the food and service to the ambiance and menu prices. I was pleased with the friendly staff that served delicious food and liked the restaurant for its casual dining. I'll come back again.

Reviews.Author: Ania
Reviews.Content: Impressed...  For starters the music in this place is perfect and I wanted to hang around just to keep listening to it. It's funky with middle eastern touches and I dig it!   The service was great and everyone was working as a team being very attentive.   Now to the food ~ overall everything was delicious and fresh. For starters they bring out herb butter for your fresh pita and it's straight out of the oven. What a nice touch! Then the regular fries and zucchini fries were perfectly crunchy and the gyros come with very flavorful meat dripping in tzatziki sauce with fresh tomatoes, red onions and lettuce. We ate everything up!   Decor is great and it's very clean. Next time I need to try the hummus because this place is called the hummus factory! We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Author: Kristine
Reviews.Content: Ordered through grub hub and received my food very fresh and hot. The lentil soup was amazing. Will order again  Thank you!!

Reviews.Author: Stefany
Reviews.Content: Formerly a food truck, the Hummus Factory finally has a brick and mortar spot- conveniently located near several gyms for healthy pre- or post-workout eats! Don't worry though, their menu isn't all healthy stuff- but it IS all tasty.  Highly recommend their salads- start at $10, add on protein separately. Price seems steep til you realize the portion could feed a whole family. The Greek with Falafel was literally all I ate one day, fresh and packed with olives. Add a side of hummus and pita, which comes out piping hot from the oven.   Went in another day for a chicken shawarma wrap- super moist with tons of tahini and grilled onions. For best results, upgrade to the eggplant fries, they're lightly battered and seasoned and frankly, life-changing. I dip them in straight Sriracha and dream of them. My guy loved the combination lunch plate(chicken and steak). The grilled onions on that are awesome too, and I like how they use a sauce and herbs in their rice to keep it from being the same generic white rice you get everywhere else in town. Meat and veggies were perfectly grilled.  Service is super friendly and treats you like a regular after just one visit. Food comes out fast and everything is super fresh. Next time, I'm having the shrimp scampi and Greek burger. And the feta app. Okay, so the whole menu probably.  TIP: Check in on the Yelp app for free hummus!

Reviews.Author: Steve
Reviews.Content: I had the Greek salad with gyro meet and an order of hummus. Best Greek salad I ever had. Dressing was understated and not over powering. Home made bread is a real treat. Service was also outstanding drank 4 ice teas and  was never empty.

Reviews.Author: Susie
Reviews.Content: Great service they are very nice and polite.  The food came out pretty quick.  Very nice environment with upbeat music not to loud and clean.  I had the chicken and filet kabob. Chicken had good flavor and was not chewy. The filet needed flavor and to be a bit less cooked. Not chewy which was good.  The lentil soup was missing a bit more spices to flavor it.   Overall I would definitely give it another try in the future.

Reviews.Author: Luca
Reviews.Content: Love this place! Food is to die for, their eggplant fries are amazing, I want to come back every day if I could! Flavors are amazing and all the food is so fresh! Also the owners are super nice and the whole atmosphere so friendly with great music! Would highly recommend this place for lunch or dinner

Reviews.Author: Melissa
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about this place! Dine in service is great, I have also picked up an order and it was great! The hummus is on point; I prefer the jalepeño hummus. They have a salad dressing that is the best thing I have ever tasted!!! No joke, THE BEST!!! Kebabs are good, gyro sandwich is good, eggplant fries and dipping sauce are OUT OF THIS WORLD, so delish! I definitely need to eat here at least once a week!!!

Reviews.Author: Tiffanie
Reviews.Content: Seriously impressed. There must be something with restaurants with the word  factory  because the Cheesecake factory has massive portions and so does this place!!  I ordered the combo kabob dinner and substituted the rice for the eggplant fries upgrade + side of baba ganoush. I can't speak for the other dishes, but the dinner portion came plated in a huge bowl with a very, very generous portion of eggplant fries and 3 wonderfully flavored skewers (I ordered 2 shrimp and 1 chicken). The flavor on the skewers and eggplant fries were delicious - whatever spices they use on the eggplant fries are wonderful! A little sweet, spicy, creamy...heaven!  The pita is also amazing - it's fluffy, served piping hot, and much better than the usual pita that other restaurants serve. Definitely coming back and won't be going back to other places!

Reviews.Author: Yosi
Reviews.Content: Went  today to try the food was thinking the restaurant is going to be wonderful the food came back over cooked and with a lot of lemon and the owner came and explained me that mediterranean  cuisine is with a lot of lemon ordered Coke and received Dr Pepper feeling unhealthy with a lot of heart Burn from the food Service people were nice no energy in the restaurant whatsoever I wish them the best of luck

Reviews.Author: Diana
Reviews.Content: I tried Hummus Factory (on Sahara) today. Wow. I'm very impressed. I ordered the chicken skewers and a salad. The food tastes fresh and very flavorful. I will definitely return. I was serviced by George and Nicki and I had prompt service and they came by my table several times and were very professional. I even enjoyed the music playing. Great experience, and I am not one to post Yelp reviews.

Reviews.Author: Tom
Reviews.Content: This is a small Ma and Pa type restaurant with great service. The pricing was decent and the food was top notch. I ordered the Kifta and it come la with a side of hummus and rice. The humus was very good, but the star of the dish was the rice! Delicious and with the perfect amount of seasoning. This Kifta was great with a good blend of meat and spices as well.

Reviews.Author: Laura
Reviews.Content: I tried to get a groupon for their neighbor hotpot restaurant but it rejected me twice. When we got outside the hot pot place it was empty so we kinda doubted. Then we chance upon Hummus Factory i had to Yelp first then decided to try it and hoping they have that freshly made pita from another Mediterranean place that starts with K. Tory the server was very pleasant and though we were the only one there tonight it felt more inviting. I used my free Hummus in Yelp and I ordered eggplant fries (based on reviews) and hubby got chicken shawarma dinner with baba ganoush as recommended by Tory. We got our hummus first that was so creamy and tasty and piping hot pita with herbed butter (yummy) that was more delicious than  K .  In our former Med resto I only eat the pita and their grape seed oil and just share from my husband's order. The flavor of the chicken shawarma and the pink sauce combo plus the rice was so scrumptious I almost want to finish his meal. There was a white sauce Tatziki maybe for the shawarma but hubby liked the my pink sauce better. My eggplant fries was awesome too but I'd like it more crispy (personal pref) again pink sauce...the bomb!  This is a gem that I started telling my friends to try it while still in the restaurant. Verdict:  I'll be back!!! I now love Mediterranean food but only in this place from now on.  Thanks Tory for a great service!!!  We couldn't finish the big portions and wanted our daughter to have some. When she got home she already ate. If I still had space in my tummy I still wanted to finish it but that's gluttony. Lol

Reviews.Author: Karen
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I decided to try the Hummus Factory for lunch and absolutely loved it! The welcome, the service AND the food was amazing!

Reviews.Author: Trinh
Reviews.Content: First time trying! Such a great place, one of the best Mediterranean restaurants I've been to. I had the mixed kabob plate with a side of hummus which was so yummy!! The costumer service is excellent! I will be coming back to visit soon.

Reviews.Author: Candace
Reviews.Content: The Skinny: generous portions but execution needs work with the entrées (3), service: great, very friendly (5), value : although the portion sizes are more than generous, the food good is just okay. Given the plethora of great Mediterranean restaurants in town, I give this one a pass.(3 starred review).  I feel bad about this review. I really wanted to like this place - the server and hostess are super nice and the ambience is clean and well kept. The problem rests with the execution of  the dishes. To be fair this place is supposed to be Mediterranean fusion so I don't now if the below comments are intentional or not.  We ordered the hummus (free with Yelp check in at time of review) which comes with freshly made pita bread, the chicken shawarma plate and the gyros sandwich plate with zucchini fries upgrade.  The hummus and pita are both good and a definite order if you go. The pita is lighter, fluffier version and served piping hot as it ought to be. The side salad that came with the chicken shawarma plate was very generous and fresh.  The entrées did not fare so well. Both proteins lacked caramelization. It was fairly obvious that the chicken shawarma was not roasted on a spit/oven in a traditional manner as it was pale and watery. I suppose it was like this when it was served seemingly sautéed with onions and tomatoes. Very strange and not what I expected when I order shawarma.   The hub's gyros has the same problem with the meat lacking the roasted flavor. His sandwich also had huge hunks (not slices) of tomatoes in it which overwhelms the meat in the sandwich.  (Oddly all the tomatoes used in our dishes were cut the same way.)  Zucchini fries were cut in a haphazard fashion leading to inconsistencies in texture (some were soggy) and uneven breading. Not worth the upgrade.  Although the service was good, the execution of the food is not worth a return visit. That being said, if you were to visit this restaurant, try to go for lunch as their prices are a little better than for dinner. 3 starred review

Reviews.Author: Francis
Reviews.Content: Vegan grape leaves, fried egg plant and Baba Ganoosh were all fantastic. Can't wait to come back again. Highly recommend for anyone. Broad, creative menu !!!

Reviews.Author: Susanna
Reviews.Content: This is the best mediterainian food I have ever had.. I even had the lamb for the furst time in my life.. Mazen was our waiter and he took care of completely.. Definately will be returning evey chance we get. The portion size was enough to feed 4 people... I had the spinach salad with gyro...simply amazing..thank you for making our experience a fantastic one.. See you soon my new friends.. Susanna & mike.......

Reviews.Author: Cindy
Reviews.Content: Food is amazing. Very fresh. We love Mediterranean food and this is now our favourite spot. We ordered the fatoosh salad. It had so much flavor. Also the eggplant fries where delicious with the Greek burger. A great lunch spot or quiet dinner.

Reviews.Author: Elizabeth
Reviews.Content: The hummus was great of course but the Greek burger and Greek fries cannot be overlooked.  Also tried the Greek salad my daughter ordered, delicious!  Can't wait to go back and try everything else.

Reviews.Author: Drew
Reviews.Content: I tried a different food for grind tonight other than my usuall food.. Dont know where to start.. The food is FRESH, pls dont believe me pls try it for yourself.. Great Flavor, seasoning n etc.. Cook is perfect, meat is not dry which is A+ in my book.. No warmer food here.. Ive seen the Chef cook his food and make his stuff in the kitchen.. Been longing to try The hummus factory but just when it comes to food it takes me hours to decide what for eat, while driving around, The hummus Factory hit my mind.. Ever since i moved to vegas tried couple places and i just didnt like it is why never did eat middle eastern food but now i have a new spot to eat when i feel like for eat Mediterrain food.. Will comeback for more.. Great Food.., Great Service... Happy Customer...Auuuraiiiiittteeeee \m/ lol

Reviews.Author: Andie
Reviews.Content: Huge fan of this place. The food is absolutely delicious. The gal that waited on us is friendly and so accommodating. It's a bit of a drive for take out for me but well worth the time. Jalapeño hummus is fabulous especially with the warm bread they serve, as well as the stuffed grape leaves. Highly recommend!!

Reviews.Author: Ayla
Reviews.Content: My family and I went here today and the food was really great. The chicken kabob was awesome and so was the lentil soup. The people working there were all wonderful and very very sweet and helpful. We'll definitely be back!

Reviews.Author: Misty
Reviews.Content: It's was our first visit. The waitress was very new but nice. I got the mini mezza(mini tapas), the menu said I could choose 6 mini samples of the appetizers or salads but when I went to order it didn't include half of the appetizers(basically no fried cheese or fries). Which was disappointing but I got it anyway. The restaurant was very empty so we didn't have to wait long for our food.  The service was good but the food was just okay.

Reviews.Author: Robert
Reviews.Content: Went for lunch on Saturday and it was a great experience.  We started with the  check in  hummus and carrot fries, both of which were fresh and tasty.  My wife & I had the meat combo and the portions were huge.  The kebob meat was a bit overdone and chewy, but the rest was cooked perfectly.  My daughter had a burger, which was excellent as well.  I got an order of ghost pepper hummus to go and it definitely had some heat.  Overall:  excellent food & service.

Reviews.Author: Rachelle
Reviews.Content: Lovely space, staff warm and welcoming. Food wonderful. I have Falafel Plate which was a huge amount of crisp non greasy falafel balls served on a bed of marinated veggies. All super good. Had a side order of baba ganoush which was lovely. I tasted the hummus which is light and very creamy. Pita bread came to the table puffed, warm and delicious.  We were a party of 15 people which they handled beautifully. It is a new restaurant in business for 3 weeks, Go there for wonderful Lebanese food.
